pullRequest.body:
Define local diffeomorphisms between smooth manifolds. As an auxiliary definition, we add `PartialDiffeomorph`, the analogue of `PartialHomeomorph` for diffeomorphisms.

In future PRs, we will
- show that local diffeomorphisms have invertible differential
- show the converse, using the inverse function theorem: if the differential of $f$ at $x$ is invertible, $f$ is a local diffeomorphism at $x$
----------------

### Alternative designs considered
A. a local diffeomorphism $M\to N$ is a diffeomorphism between open sets $U\subset M$ and $V\subset N$ containing $x$ and $f(x)$, respectively.

mathlib already has diffeomorphisms; this definition would be cumbersome to use, as proving e.g. openness of the image or "a diffeomorphism is a local diffeomorphism" required dealing with subtypes U, V instead of M and N.

B. use the junk value pattern, but bundle a choice of inverse (i.e., replace IsLocalDiffeomorphAt with the current LocalDiffeomorphAux together with a proof that $x\in source$
This makes the implication "if $f$ is a local diffeomorphism at every point $x$, it's a local diffeomorphism" at least tedious to state and prove. With the current design, that's by definition.

nodes.body: To comment on your naming remark: I want to rename `LocalHomeomorph` to `PartialHomeomorph`.

> To comment on your naming remark: I want to rename `LocalHomeomorph` to `PartialHomeomorph`.

By the way, should `LocalHomeomorph.continuous_{toFun,invFun}` be renamed to `continuousOn_{toFun,invFun}`? (Also out of scope for this PR.) This would match `Diffeomorph` and the actual type of their hypotheses.
Yes, they should be.

I have merged master and fixed the build (for this and two more renames of mine).
awaiting-review
Can you also adapt the PR description?
@sgouezel Indeed, done. I also took the opportunity to golf my proof a little, by relating local diffeomorphisms to local homeos.
Updated again; thanks for the comments.
awaiting-review

Updated again, and made a few related golfs.
awaiting-review
awaiting-review

Makes sense; I keep learning more best practices for mathlib. Thanks for explaining all these to me.

(I wonder if these rules, e.g. "make arguments implicit if they can be inferred from the others" or "a hypothesis which is used in dot notation should be the first explicit argument" could be linted automatically. Put perhaps there are too many exceptions for this to be worthwhile.)
It's pretty hard to lint those since there are a lot of exceptions. It's rules that one shoud keep in mind, and break sometimes but only in a deliberate way.

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7298327844/job/19889087019)

bors d+
Thanks!
Two of my comments apparently were not submitted. -- EDIT: I think they were, my browser incorrectly showed them as "pending".
Two of my comments apparently were not submitted. -- EDIT: I think they were, my browser incorrectly showed them as "pending".
Can you merge master and fix the build (`LocalEquiv` has been renamed to `PartialEquiv`)? Thanks!

bors d+
Thanks!
If you extend `LocalHomeomorph`, you get the fields `continuousOn_toFun` and `continuousOn_invFun`, which follow from the new fields. Maybe only extend `LocalEquiv`?
I'm not too happy with the current name. I'd be fine with the name `PartialDiffeomorph` (with a todo to rename the others).
PartialDiffeomorph and PartialHomeomorph sound much nicer!

> If you extend `LocalHomeomorph`, you get the fields `continuousOn_toFun` and `continuousOn_invFun`, which follow from the new fields. Maybe only extend `LocalEquiv`?

Sure, that works. It's slightly more cumbersome as I have to define the fields open_source and open_target, but only very slightly so. 

In general, is it important to not re-define data this way? (I can *imagine* it is, but don't *know* for sure.)

This doesn't seem like the most convenient definition of `IsLocalDiffeomorphAt`. For vector spaces we don't really give a definition, but in the statement of the inverse function theorem [HasStrictFDerivAt.to_localInverse](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Calculus/Inverse.html#HasStrictFDerivAt.to_localInverse) we use [HasStrictFDerivAt](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Calculus/FDeriv/Basic.html#HasStrictFDerivAt). Would it make sense to lift that definition to manifolds?

Good point! Over R or C, both definitions are indeed equivalent (one direction follows from the inverse function theorem, the other is PR #8738) --- so it's merely a matter of taste or convenience. In several cases, I find the current definition nicer to use (e.g., a local diffeomorphism has open range, I just added that a bijective local diffeomorphism is a diffeomorphism); for showing a particular map is a local diffeomorphism, the other definition can be more useful. Eventually, we should have both --- and I am indeed working on the inverse function theorem also. 

I had chosen my definition to match [local structomorphisms](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Geometry/Manifold/LocalInvariantProperties.html#StructureGroupoid.IsLocalStructomorphWithinAt) and local homeomorphisms (in the sense of textbook mathematics, not `PartialHomeomorph`s). To me, this definition feels more conceptually correct; I regard the coincidence with isomorphic differential is a special fact for `C^n` maps.

That said: I don't know if these definitions are still equivalent over p-adic numbers, and which definition is correct on that setting.

@sgouezel Do you know more? What's your opinion here?
It would be nice to at least define `symm`, and state `Φ.invFun` as `Φ.symm` (with a coercion) everywhere. That's how we do it for all other equivalence-like structures.
Please also have `isOpen (range f)` as a separate lemma.
Makes sense - it's basically just extracting that proof. Added.

```suggestion
open Manifold Set TopologicalSpace
```

```suggestion
and `t` of `x` and `f x`, respectively such that `f` restricts to a diffeomorphism between `s` and `t`.
```
From here on, `I` and `J` should probably be implicit, as they can be recovered from `Φ`.

```suggestion
def toPartialHomeomorph : PartialHomeomorph M N where
    toPartialEquiv := Φ.toPartialEquiv
    open_source := Φ.open_source
    open_target := Φ.open_target
    continuousOn_toFun := Φ.contMDiffOn_toFun.continuousOn
    continuousOn_invFun := Φ.contMDiffOn_invFun.continuousOn
```
This is the standard syntax in mathlib, hopefully more readable.

Same thing several times below.
I've used two-space indentation, though. :-)
You shouldn't need this one, as well as the other `symm` versions below: just call `Φ.symm.contMDiffOn`, which isn't longer.
Fair enough. I went by comparing with PartialHomeomorph, which has almost all lemmas also for `symm`...

You're missing `IsLocalDiffeomorphOn`. In all the examples I can think of, when we didn't define the `On` version to start with, we have regretted it later on and we had to refactor things. So, would you agree to add it from the start? (I know it's more work, of course...)
I was wondering about this :-) I'll trust your collective experience, I'll add it.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion PartialDiffeomorph I J M N n where ```
could you move this to the section on partial diffeomorphisms?
This lemma should be named `IsLocalDiffeomorphAt.contMDiffAt`, to enable dot notation. Same thing for most lemmas below.

```suggestion
theorem IsLocalDiffeomorphOn.isLocalHomeomorphOn {s : Set M} (hf : IsLocalDiffeomorphOn I J n f s) :
```
for dot notation again. Same thing below.

once you've done the changes to enable dot notation, this proof becomes for instance
```suggestion
  hf.isLocalHomeomorph.isOpenMap
```
Same thing below.

```suggestion
    {f : M → N} (hf : IsLocalDiffeomorph I J n f) (s : Set M) :
```
When using dot notation, the item corresponding to dot notation should come as the first explicit argument if possible, as otherwise partial applications can be a mess.
`I J M N n` should be implicit in this definition, as they can be inferred from `h`.

I J s should all be implicit, as they can be inferred from either side of the equivalence.

Could you please double-check all statements in the file with respect to explicitness/implicitness of the variables? Thanks!

```suggestion
noncomputable def IsLocalDiffeomorph.diffeomorph_of_bijective
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: local diffeomorphisms

source.title: feat: differential of a local diffeomorphism is a continuous linear equivalence
